system.name: DineOut
system.description: DineOut is a restaurant management system developed with the intention of automating the day-to-day tasks in a restaurant like order and inventory management, bill generation, and taking feedback.
system.purpose: The purpose of DineOut is to improve the performance of the restaurant by eradicating the daily paperwork, minimizing human error, and reducing labor costs.
system.scope: The scope of DineOut includes order management, inventory management, bill generation, and customer feedback. It is designed for use in restaurants and will be accessed by customers, hall managers, head chefs, admins, and chefs.

stakeholders.name: Customer
stakeholders.description: The end-user who places orders and interacts with the system

stakeholders.name: Head Chef
stakeholders.description: Responsible for managing kitchen operations and assigning orders to chefs

stakeholders.name: Hall Manager
stakeholders.description: Oversees the dining area and manages table assignments and order status

stakeholders.name: Admin
stakeholders.description: Responsible for system administration, including staff management and menu updates

stakeholders.name: Chef
stakeholders.description: Prepares dishes and manages their respective queues

stakeholders.name: Waiter
stakeholders.description: Assists customers with ordering and serves food

functional_requirements.description: The system shall allow customers to scroll through the menu and select the dishes they want.
The system shall allow customers to cancel or edit their order at any time before it is prepared.
The system shall allow customers to provide feedback regarding the food and overall service of the restaurant.
The system shall allow customers to request a bill.
The system shall allow customers to ask for help through the system.
The system shall assign the Head Chef to assign dishes in an order to chefs according to their specialties.
The system shall show dish queues and their status for chefs.
The system shall allow the admin to perform CRUD operations on staff members, menu items, and inventory.
The system shall allow the Head Chef to mark orders as complete.
The system shall allow the Head Chef to approve the cancellation of a dish or order.
The system shall allow the Hall Manager to mark a bill as paid.
The system shall notify the Hall Manager when a particular order is complete.
The system shall allow the Hall Manager to see and edit the status of tables reserved and available, and their capacities.
The system shall place an order in the 'pending orders' table in the Firebase database when a customer places an order.
The system shall notify the Head Chef of pending orders.
The system shall allow the Head Chef to assign a dish to a particular chef based on the specialty of the chef.
The system shall allow chefs to see the new order in their screens or on a central display in the kitchen.
The system shall print the bill through the Manager's interface.
The system shall allow the Admin to add, edit, or delete menu items.
The system shall allow the Admin to add, edit, or delete staff members.
